column1: First: - Wash your hands well with soap and warm water.
- The medicine should be liquid, or finely crushed and dissolved in water, so that the tube does not get blocked.

Call your child's health care provider if your child: - Seems hungry after the feeding - Has diarrhea after feedings - Has a hard and swollen belly 1 hour after feedings - Seems to be in pain - Has changes in their condition - Is on new medicine - Is constipated and passing hard, dry stools Also call the doctor if: - The feeding tube has come out and you do not know how to replace it.
